column4: if you use ccsm you can see if the unity plug in is enabled if it is its 3d
the unity plug in is enabled. how do i get ubuntu to default to unity 2d? you used to be able to do it just by logging out, and then logging back in the d.e. you desired...
no, this has been a problem since 11.10. I was hoping with the last update they would have fixed it. i haven't found a decent solution either.
its on the gear symbol when you log in
i know that, but "ubuntu 2d" doesn't stay the default. i log out, and then i'm defaulted back to regualr unity.
if you use dconf you can tick the box to save session
thanks, i'll take a look at that.
actually, dconf refuses to run, even when i sudo it, and ccsm screwed up regular unity bad. fixing ccsm problem currently. lol. new systems, new bugs. I love ubuntu, definetly a challennge. :)
no, fresh install. it's been a real learning grade with unity, but i'm getting the hang of things.
i have to log out to repair ccsm damage.
think you can just set ccsm back to its unity defaults
yeah, lightdm stores your default for your current session, but as soon as you reboot, unity "3d" is the default./
dconf refuses to launch, whether in the menu, or in the terminal... i installed via apt...
thanks for helping me, i'm gonna log out now, (messing with settings, who knows...)
